title: How good nnU-Net for Segmenting Cardiac MRI: A Comprehensive Evaluation
authors: Malitha Gunawardhana, Fangqiang Xu, Jichao Zhao
abstract:
Cardiac segmentation is a critical task in medical imaging, essential for
detailed analysis of heart structures, which is crucial for diagnosing and
treating various cardiovascular diseases. With the advent of deep learning,
automated segmentation techniques have demonstrated remarkable progress,
achieving high accuracy and efficiency compared to traditional manual methods.
Among these techniques, the nnU-Net framework stands out as a robust and
versatile tool for medical image segmentation. In this study, we evaluate the
performance of nnU-Net in segmenting cardiac magnetic resonance images (MRIs).
Utilizing five cardiac segmentation datasets, we employ various nnU-Net
configurations, including 2D, 3D full resolution, 3D low resolution, 3D
cascade, and ensemble models. Our study benchmarks the capabilities of these
configurations and examines the necessity of developing new models for specific
cardiac segmentation tasks.
